newsitem.title: FINLAND: Raisio sees no competition from Campbell.
newsitem.headline: Raisio sees no competition from Campbell.

text.p: Finnish food, animal feeds and chemicals group Raision Tehtaat Oy said on Monday U.S. company Campbell Soup Co's new mail-order meals will not compete with its cholesterol-reducing Benecol margarine.

"They will not be competitors. The (Campbell) meals concerned are based on normal nutrition components, which are combined in a certain way," Jukka Kaitaranta, head of Raisio's Benecol unit told Reuters by telephone.

Kaitaranta was asked to comment on a report in Friday's New York Times about Campbell's plans to begin selling frozen meals engineered to reduce cholesterol, blood pressure and diabetes by mail-order delivery.
Campbell's meals cannot be based on Benecol's key ingredient plant sterol as Raisio has a U.S. patent for it, Kaitaranta said.
